intro: Nemacladus ramosissimus var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender branching broom, is a low-growing shrub characterized by its dense, wiry stems and small, pale green leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, contributing to its ornamental value. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ability to withstand poor soil conditions. Its rapid growth and spreading habit make it an effective ground cover in suitable climates.
